content: 1 Beginning of the glad-message of Jesus Christ.
content_old: 1 Beginning of the glad-message of Jesus Christ.

content: 2 According as it is written in Isaiah the prophet— Lo! I send my messenger before thy face､ Who shall prepare thy way,—
content_old: 2 According as it is written in Isaiah the prophet— Lo! I send my messenger before thy face､ Who shall prepare thy way,—

content: 3 A voice of one crying aloud— In the wilderness prepare ye the way of the Lord, Straight be making his paths
content_old: 3 A voice of one crying aloud— In the wilderness prepare ye the way of the Lord, Straight be making his paths

content: 4 John the Immerser came, in the wilderness proclaiming an immersion of repentance､ for remission of sins;
content_old: 4 John the Immerser came, in the wilderness proclaiming an immersion of repentance､ for remission of sins;

content: 5 and there were going out unto him all the Judæa country､ and all they of Jerusalem, and were being immersed by him､ in the Jordan river, openly confessing their sins;
content_old: 5 and there were going out unto him all the Judæa country､ and all they of Jerusalem, and were being immersed by him､ in the Jordan river, openly confessing their sins;

content: 6 and John was clothed with camel’s-hair､ and a leathern girdle about his loins, and was eating locusts and wild honey;
content_old: 6 and John was clothed with camel’s-hair､ and a leathern girdle about his loins, and was eating locusts and wild honey;

content: 7 and he proclaimed, saying— He that is mightier than I cometh after me, Of whom I am not worthy to stoop and unloose the strap of his sandals:
content_old: 7 and he proclaimed, saying— He that is mightier than I cometh after me, Of whom I am not worthy to stoop and unloose the strap of his sandals:

content: 8 I have immersed you with water,— He will immerse you with the Holy Spirit.
content_old: 8 I have immersed you with water,— He will immerse you with the Holy Spirit.

content: 9 And it came to pass､ in those days, that Jesus came from Nazareth of Galilee､ and was immersed into the Jordan by John;
content_old: 9 And it came to pass､ in those days, that Jesus came from Nazareth of Galilee､ and was immersed into the Jordan by John;

content: 10 And straightway as he was coming up out of the water he saw the heavens rending asunder, and the Spirit､ as a dove descending unto him;
content_old: 10 And straightway as he was coming up out of the water he saw the heavens rending asunder, and the Spirit､ as a dove descending unto him;

content: 11 and a voice came out of the heavens— Thou art my Son､ the Beloved,— In thee I delight.
content_old: 11 and a voice came out of the heavens— Thou art my Son､ the Beloved,— In thee I delight.

content: 12 And straightway the Spirit urgeth him forth into the wilderness;
content_old: 12 And straightway the Spirit urgeth him forth into the wilderness;

content: 13 and he was in the wilderness､ forty days､ tempted by Satan, and was with the wild beasts,—and the messengers were ministering unto him.
content_old: 13 and he was in the wilderness､ forty days､ tempted by Satan, and was with the wild beasts,—and the messengers were ministering unto him.

content: 14 And after John was delivered up Jesus came into Galilee､ proclaiming the glad-message of God,
content_old: 14 And after John was delivered up Jesus came into Galilee､ proclaiming the glad-message of God,

content: 15 and saying— The season is fulfilled, And the kingdom of God hath drawn near,— Repent ye､ and have faith in the glad-message.
content_old: 15 and saying— The season is fulfilled, And the kingdom of God hath drawn near,— Repent ye､ and have faith in the glad-message.

content: 16 And passing by near the sea of Galilee he saw Simon､ and Andrew the brother of Simon､ casting a net in the sea,—for they were fishers;
content_old: 16 And passing by near the sea of Galilee he saw Simon､ and Andrew the brother of Simon､ casting a net in the sea,—for they were fishers;

content: 17 and Jesus said unto them— Come after me, And I will make you become fishers of men;
content_old: 17 and Jesus said unto them— Come after me, And I will make you become fishers of men;

content: 18 and straightway leaving the nets they followed him.
content_old: 18 and straightway leaving the nets they followed him.

content: 19 And going forward a little he saw James the son of Zebedee､ and John his brother, and them who were in the boat putting in order the nets;
content_old: 19 And going forward a little he saw James the son of Zebedee､ and John his brother, and them who were in the boat putting in order the nets;

content: 20 and straightway he called them,—and leaving their father Zebedee in the boat､ with the hired men they came away after him.
content_old: 20 and straightway he called them,—and leaving their father Zebedee in the boat､ with the hired men they came away after him.

content: 21 And they journey into Capernaum. And straightway､ on the Sabbath entering into the synagogue he began teaching;
content_old: 21 And they journey into Capernaum. And straightway､ on the Sabbath entering into the synagogue he began teaching;

content: 22 and they were being struck with astonishment at his teaching,—for he was teaching them as one having authority, and not as the Scribes.
content_old: 22 and they were being struck with astonishment at his teaching,—for he was teaching them as one having authority, and not as the Scribes.

content: 23 And straightway there was in their synagogue､ a man in an impure spirit,—and he cried out aloud,
content_old: 23 And straightway there was in their synagogue､ a man in an impure spirit,—and he cried out aloud,

content: 24 saying— What have we in common with thee､ Jesus of Nazareth? Hast thou come to destroy us? I know thee､ who thou art, The Holy One of God.
content_old: 24 saying— What have we in common with thee､ Jesus of Nazareth? Hast thou come to destroy us? I know thee､ who thou art, The Holy One of God.

content: 25 And Jesus rebuked him, saying— Be silenced, and come forth out of him!
content_old: 25 And Jesus rebuked him, saying— Be silenced, and come forth out of him!

content: 26 And the impure spirit tearing him､ and calling out with a loud voice came forth out of him;
content_old: 26 And the impure spirit tearing him､ and calling out with a loud voice came forth out of him;

content: 27 and they were amazed､ one and all, so that they began to discuss among themselves, saying— What is this? New teaching! With authority､ to the impure spirits also he giveth orders, and they obey him!
content_old: 27 and they were amazed､ one and all, so that they began to discuss among themselves, saying— What is this? New teaching! With authority､ to the impure spirits also he giveth orders, and they obey him!

content: 28 And forth went the report of him､ straightway､ on every hand, into the surrounding country of Galilee.
content_old: 28 And forth went the report of him､ straightway､ on every hand, into the surrounding country of Galilee.

content: 29 And straightway､ out of the synagogue､ going forth he went unto the house of Simon and Andrew､ with James and John.
content_old: 29 And straightway､ out of the synagogue､ going forth he went unto the house of Simon and Andrew､ with James and John.

content: 30 Now the mother-in-law of Simon was lying in a fever, and straightway they speak to him concerning her;
content_old: 30 Now the mother-in-law of Simon was lying in a fever, and straightway they speak to him concerning her;

content: 31 and､ coming near､ he raised her up, grasping her hand,—and the fever left her, and she began ministering unto them.
content_old: 31 and､ coming near､ he raised her up, grasping her hand,—and the fever left her, and she began ministering unto them.

content: 32 And evening arriving, when the sun went in they were bearing unto him all who were sick､ and them who were demonized;
content_old: 32 And evening arriving, when the sun went in they were bearing unto him all who were sick､ and them who were demonized;

content: 33 and all the city was gathered unto the door;
content_old: 33 and all the city was gathered unto the door;

content: 34 and he cured many that were sick with divers diseases, and many demons he cast out, and suffered not the demons to be talking,—because they knew him to be Christ.
content_old: 34 and he cured many that were sick with divers diseases, and many demons he cast out, and suffered not the demons to be talking,—because they knew him to be Christ.

content: 35 And very early by night arising he went out and departed into a desert place, and there was praying;
content_old: 35 And very early by night arising he went out and departed into a desert place, and there was praying;

content: 36 and Simon､ and they who were with him､ went in quest of him,
content_old: 36 and Simon､ and they who were with him､ went in quest of him,

content: 37 and found him, and say unto him— All are seeking thee;
content_old: 37 and found him, and say unto him— All are seeking thee;

content: 38 and he saith unto them— Let us be going elsewhere､ into the neighbouring country-towns, in order that there also I may be making proclamation,—for to this end came I forth;
content_old: 38 and he saith unto them— Let us be going elsewhere､ into the neighbouring country-towns, in order that there also I may be making proclamation,—for to this end came I forth;

content: 39 and he came､ making proclamation､ into their synagogues, throughout the whole of Galilee,—and was casting the demons out.

content: 40 And there cometh unto him､ a leper, beseeching him and kneeling,—saying unto him— If thou be willing thou canst cleanse me;
content_old: 40 And there cometh unto him､ a leper, beseeching him and kneeling,—saying unto him— If thou be willing thou canst cleanse me;

content: 41 and moved with compassion he stretched forth the hand､ and touched him, and saith unto him— I am willing, Be cleansed!
content_old: 41 and moved with compassion he stretched forth the hand､ and touched him, and saith unto him— I am willing, Be cleansed!

content: 42 and straightway the leprosy departed from him, and he was cleansed;
content_old: 42 and straightway the leprosy departed from him, and he was cleansed;

content: 43 and strictly charging him straightway he urged him forth;
content_old: 43 and strictly charging him straightway he urged him forth;

content: 44 and saith unto him— Mind! unto no one say aught,—but withdraw, thyself show unt o the priest､ and offer for thy cleansing what things Moses enjoined for a witness unto them.
content_old: 44 and saith unto him— Mind! unto no one say aught,—but withdraw, thyself show unt o the priest､ and offer for thy cleansing what things Moses enjoined for a witness unto them.

content: 1 And entering again into Capernaum､ after some days it was heard say— He is in a house;
content_old: 1 And entering again into Capernaum､ after some days it was heard say— He is in a house;

content: 2 and many were gathered together, so that no longer was there room even in the approaches to the door,—and he began speaking unto them the word;
content_old: 2 and many were gathered together, so that no longer was there room even in the approaches to the door,—and he began speaking unto them the word;

content: 3 and they come､ bearing unto him a paralytic, upborne by four,—
content_old: 3 and they come､ bearing unto him a paralytic, upborne by four,—

content: 4 and not being able to get near him､ by reason of the multitude they uncovered the roof where he was, and having broken it up they began letting down the couch whereon the paralytic was lying;
content_old: 4 and not being able to get near him､ by reason of the multitude they uncovered the roof where he was, and having broken it up they began letting down the couch whereon the paralytic was lying;

content: 5 and Jesus､ seeing their faith saith unto the paralytic— Child! forgiven are thy sins!
content_old: 5 and Jesus､ seeing their faith saith unto the paralytic— Child! forgiven are thy sins!

content: 6 Now there were certain of the Scribes there､ sitting and deliberating in their hearts,—
content_old: 6 Now there were certain of the Scribes there､ sitting and deliberating in their hearts,—

content: 7 Why doth this man thus talk? he is speaking profanely! Who can forgive sins save one､ God?
content_old: 7 Why doth this man thus talk? he is speaking profanely! Who can forgive sins save one､ God?

content: 8 And Jesus straightway taking note in his spirit､ that thus they are deliberating within themselves saith unto them— Why these things are ye deliberating in your hearts?
content_old: 8 And Jesus straightway taking note in his spirit､ that thus they are deliberating within themselves saith unto them— Why these things are ye deliberating in your hearts?

content: 9 Which is easier— To say unto the paralytic､ Forgiven are thy sins, Or to say､ Rise､ and take up thy couch, and be walking?
content_old: 9 Which is easier— To say unto the paralytic､ Forgiven are thy sins, Or to say､ Rise､ and take up thy couch, and be walking?

content: 10 But that ye may know that the Son of Man hath authority to be forgiving sins upon the earth he saith to the paralytic:
content_old: 10 But that ye may know that the Son of Man hath authority to be forgiving sins upon the earth he saith to the paralytic:

content: 11 To thee I say､ Rise､ take up thy couch, and be going thy way unto thy house.
content_old: 11 To thee I say､ Rise､ take up thy couch, and be going thy way unto thy house.

content: 12 And he arose, and straightway taking up the couch went forth before all,—so that all were beside themselves､ and were glorifying God, saying— Thus we never saw it!
content_old: 12 And he arose, and straightway taking up the couch went forth before all,—so that all were beside themselves､ and were glorifying God, saying— Thus we never saw it!

content: 13 And he went forth again by the sea,—and all the multitude was coming unto him, and he began teaching them.
content_old: 13 And he went forth again by the sea,—and all the multitude was coming unto him, and he began teaching them.

content: 14 And､ passing by､ he saw Levi､ the son of Alphæus, sitting over the tax-office,—and saith unto him— Be following me! and､ arising､ he followed him.
content_old: 14 And､ passing by､ he saw Levi､ the son of Alphæus, sitting over the tax-office,—and saith unto him— Be following me! and､ arising､ he followed him.

content: 15 And it cometh to pass､ that he is reclining in his house, and many tax-collectors and sinners were reclining with Jesus and his disciples; for there were many, and they began following him.
content_old: 15 And it cometh to pass､ that he is reclining in his house, and many tax-collectors and sinners were reclining with Jesus and his disciples; for there were many, and they began following him.

content: 16 And the Scribes and Pharisees seeing that he was eating with the sinners and the tax-collectors began saying unto his disciples— With the tax-collectors and sinners is he eating?
content_old: 16 And the Scribes and Pharisees seeing that he was eating with the sinners and the tax-collectors began saying unto his disciples— With the tax-collectors and sinners is he eating?

content: 17 And hearing it Jesus saith unto them— No need have the strong of a physician, but they who are sick,— I came not to call the righteous but sinners.
content_old: 17 And hearing it Jesus saith unto them— No need have the strong of a physician, but they who are sick,— I came not to call the righteous but sinners.

content: 18 And the disciples of John and the Pharisees were fasting; and they come and say unto him— For what cause do the disciples of John and the disciples of the Pharisees fast, whereas thy disciples fast not?
content_old: 18 And the disciples of John and the Pharisees were fasting; and they come and say unto him— For what cause do the disciples of John and the disciples of the Pharisees fast, whereas thy disciples fast not?

content: 19 And Jesus said unto them— Is it possible for the sons of the bridechamber while the bridegroom is with them to be fasting? So long as they have the bridegroom with them it is impossible to fast.
content_old: 19 And Jesus said unto them— Is it possible for the sons of the bridechamber while the bridegroom is with them to be fasting? So long as they have the bridegroom with them it is impossible to fast.

content: 20 But there will come days when the bridegroom shall be taken from them and then they will fast in that day.
content_old: 20 But there will come days when the bridegroom shall be taken from them and then they will fast in that day.

content: 21 No one seweth a patch of unshrunk cloth upon an old mantle,—otherwise､ at least the shrinking teareth away from it—the new from the old—and a worse rent is made.
content_old: 21 No one seweth a patch of unshrunk cloth upon an old mantle,—otherwise､ at least the shrinking teareth away from it—the new from the old—and a worse rent is made.

content: 22 And no one poureth new wine into old skins,—otherwise､ at least the wine will burst tho skins, and the wine is lost､ and the skins. But new wine is for unused skins.
content_old: 22 And no one poureth new wine into old skins,—otherwise､ at least the wine will burst tho skins, and the wine is lost､ and the skins. But new wine is for unused skins.

content: 23 And it came to pass､ that he on the Sabbath was passing through the cornfields, and his disciples began to be going forward､ plucking the ears of corn.

content: 24 And the Pharisees were saying— See! why are they doing､ on the Sabbath､ what is not allowed?
content_old: 24 And the Pharisees were saying— See! why are they doing､ on the Sabbath､ what is not allowed?

content: 25 And he saith unto them— Have ye never read､ what David did, when he had need and hungered,—he､ and they who were with him:
content_old: 25 And he saith unto them— Have ye never read､ what David did, when he had need and hungered,—he､ and they who were with him:

content: 26 how he entered into the house of God､ while Abiathar was High-priest, and the presence-bread did eat,—which it is not allowed to eat､ save unto the priests,—and gave unto them also who were with him?

content: 1 And he entered again into a synagogue, and there-was there､ a man having his hand withered;

content: 2 and they were narrowly watching him, whether on the Sabbath he would cure him, that they might accuse him.

content: 4 and saith unto them— Is it allowed on the Sabbath to do good､ or to do evil? To save life, or to slay? but they remained silent.

content: 5 And looking round upon them with anger､ being at the same time grieved on account of the hardening of their heart he saith unto the man— Stretch forth thy hand! and he stretched it forth, and his hand was restored.

content: 7 And Jesus､ with his disciples retired unto the sea; and a great throng from Galilee followed, also from Judæa､

content: 1 And again began he to be teaching by the sea; and there come together unto him a very great multitude, so that he､ into a boat entering､ was sitting upon the sea,—and all the multitude were near the sea upon the land.

content: 8 And other fell into the good ground, and was yielding fruit､ coming up and growing,—and was bearing､ thirtyfold and sixtyfold and a hundredfold,

content: 9 And he was saying— He that hath ears to hear let him hear!
